page.title: 12CHELMSFORD CATHEDRAL
page.content: The Cathedral Church of St. Mary the Virgin,St.Peter and St.Cedd,is the {parish church of Chelmsford.}It is situated at the head of the High St.on an{ancient raised site.}Although the present building was erected around {1420,}there is evidence of a church on the site much earlier, possibly from Saxon times. The Diocese of Chelmsford{is the 2nd. {largest in terms of population. Much modified over the years,the last reordering of the Cathedral interior was in{1983.}This included the installation of a new floor,altar,a wall hanging by Beryl Dean and the {strikingly-designed ironwork of cross, {ambos and chapel screens by Giuseppe {Lund.}The new interlocking chairs replaced the Nave pews,allowing the area to be cleared for use during musical and dramatic events.
